intro: Randia coffeoides, commonly known as the coffee tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed, often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties make it a notable species in horticulture and ethnobotany.
